Comparative Long: Adjectives > Comparative form of long adjectives
Adjectives > Comparative form of short adjectives
Adjectives > Positive form of all adjectives
Adjectives > Superlative form of long adjectives
Adjectives > Superlative form of short adjectives
Adverbs > Comparative form of long adverbs
Adverbs > Comparative form of short adverbs
Adverbs > Positive form of all adverbs
Adverbs > Superlative form of long adverbs
Adverbs > Superlative form of short adverbs
All perfect tenses. Have/has/had/will have + done.
All perfect progressive tenses. Have/has/had/will have + been + doing.
All progressive tenses. Am/is/are/was/were/will be + doing.
A subordinate clause functioning as an adverb, e.g. John's goldfish died when he was 3.
A subordinate clause that defines a noun phrase and starts with a relative pronoun (who, which, that, where, when, whose, whom), e.g. John saw Sam who was talking to his parents.
A subordinate clause that defines a noun phrase (an object from another clause) but does not start with a relative pronoun, e.g. John ate an apple he bought a day ago.
A clause that is dependent on the main clause and usually starts with a conjunction, e.g. Even though John goes snowboarding every year, he does not own a snowboard.

An if-clause of four types: real present, unreal present, unreal past, and mixed, e.g. If John works hard, he will get far. If I were you, I would talk to John about it. If John had known this before, he would have told you. If John had not seen this movie, he would watch it with us now.
An if-clause describing a fact or a situation when a certain condition has to be met, e.g. If John wakes up early, he goes jogging. If John has enough time, he will join us.

An if-clause describing an unprobable or an impossible situation in the present or past, e.g. If John were here, he would tell you the same thing. If John had been more careful, he would not have got into trouble.
All non-simple conjunctions, e.g. therefore, until, besides
The following conjunctions: and, or, but, because, so
A clause starting with there is/are/was/were/will be, e.g. There is no internet connection in this room.
A verb at the beginning of an imperative clause, e.g. Write this down. Watch out!
A verb that indicates likelihood, ability, permission, or obligation, e.g. might, can, ought to, must
e.g. We were not able to reach John.
All non-simple modal verbs, e.g. ought to, able to, should.
e.g. John can draw pretty well.
As the past form of "can" or a separate modal verb, e.g. John could climb trees when he was 7. I could call you at 8pm.
e.g. Sorry, it is already late, I have to go.
e.g. May I ask a question?
As the past form of "may" or a separate modal verb, e.g. John might have won that game. This might be true.
e.g. Everyone ought to respect the law.
The following modal verbs: can, must, need, may
All forms of negation: no, not, never, nobody, partial negation (e.g. barely, hardly)
e.g. John has not been to the US before.
e.g. You have no right to say that. We do not know John well enough. Sam has never seen John.
e.g. John isn't feeling very well.
The following adverbs: hardly, barely, scarcely, rarely, seldom, e.g. John could hardly understand the lecture.
Nouns derived from verbs and ending with -ing, e.g. skiing, being, but also building.
A verb that takes one direct object, e.g. John drives a Mercedes.
A verb that takes a direct and an indirect object, e.g. Please, pass this book to me.
e.g. This book was written by George R. R. Martin.
Nouns > Irregular plural form of nouns
Nouns > Regular plural form of nouns
All non-simple prepositions, e.g. between, above, after
Prepositions consisting of two or more words, e.g. apart from, by means of
The following prepositions: at, on, in, to, with, after
Personal, possessive, indefinite, interrogative, reflexive, relative, demonstrative pronouns
e.g. somewhere, everything, nobody, neither, another
All question words, e.g. what, where, which, how
Any pronoun used as an object, e.g. me, him, them
Any pronoun used as a subject, e.g. I, everyone, something
All direct questions, e.g. What is the capital of Germany?
Questions starting with "how", e.g. How are you doing today?
Questions reported using indirect speech, e.g. John asked when he should come.
Questions starting with a modal verb, e.g. Could you help me?
e.g. It is still raining outside, isn't it?
Yes/no questions starting with a form of the verb "be", e.g. Are you listening to me?
Yes/no questions starting with a form of the verb "do", e.g. Did you go to the cinema at the weekend?
Questions > "Have" questions (Perfect or Perfect Progressive Aspect)
Yes/no questions starting with a form of the verb "have", e.g. Have you ever seen a snake? Have you been studying for the last hour?
All non-yes/no questions, e.g. When is John's birthday? Which text have you read?
Questions starting with "what", e.g. What date is it today?
Questions starting with "when", e.g. When is the next break?
Questions starting with "where", e.g. Where did you go on holidays last summer?
Questions starting with "which", e.g. Which topic have you chosen for your presentation?
Questions starting with "who", e.g. Who is absent today?
Questions starting with "whom", e.g. Whom should I contact?
Questions starting with "whose", e.g. Whose turn is it?
Questions starting with "why", e.g. Why are you asking me this question?
General yes/no questions starting with an auxiliary verb, e.g. Is John busy now? Have you completed the task?
A sentence consisting of at least one independent (main) and one dependent (subordinate) clause, e.g. John is reading a book that Sam has given to him.
A sentence consisting of two or more independent clauses, e.g. John was reading, and Sam was watching TV.
A simple sentence missing either a subject or a predicate, e.g. Him. Don't. What a shame.
A sentence consisting of one clause that contains a subject and a predicate, e.g. John loves peanut butter.
e.g. John will have been here for one year on June 3rd.
Verbs > Tenses > Future perfect progressive tense
e.g. John will have been writing his essay for 3 days at 10pm tonight.
e.g. John will be working late tonight.
e.g. John will reply to your email when he has time.
e.g. John had already seen this movie before we watched it together.
Verbs > Tenses > Past perfect progressive tense
e.g. We had been driving very fast before we saw the speed limit sign.
e.g. John and Sam were having lunch when I came by yesterday.
e.g. John dressed up as a pumpkin last Halloween.
e.g. John and Sam have already prepared their presentation.
Verbs > Tenses > Present perfect progressive tense
e.g. John has been playing this online game for the last 5 hours.
e.g. My family and I are enjoying our holidays in Spain right now.
e.g. John wakes up at 7am every day.
e.g. There is no juice left in the fridge.
e.g. There were too many people, so we left.
All future tenses. Will/shall + do/be doing/have done/have been doing
All past tenses. Did/was/were doing/had done/had been doing
All present tenses. Do/does/am/is/are doing/have/has done/have/has been doing
An intention. Going to + verb, e.g. John is going to invite you to his party.
A habitual action in the past. Used to + verb, e.g. John used to play football every day when he was a kid.
Auxiliaries "be" and "have" (short and full forms), e.g. I am, He's
Copular verbs be, seem, look, stay, etc, e.g. She looks upset.
e.g. I did tell the truth.
Base form of the verb, e.g. John can draw pretty well.
Gerunds and present participles, e.g. John likes swimming. You are constantly arguing with me.
Verbs > Verb forms > Full auxiliary form
Full form of the auxiliaries "be" and "have", e.g. I am, he has, we are
Verbs > Verb forms > Contracted auxiliary form
Contracted form of the auxiliaries "be" and "have", e.g. I'm, he's, we're
Base form of the verb precedes by "to", e.g. John wants to talk to you.
Irregular forms V2 and V3, e.g. bought, said, forgot
Phrasal or particle verbs, e.g. speak up, get off, watch out
Regular forms V2 and V3, e.g. liked, typed, selected
Full and contracted forms of "be" and "have", e.g. am, 's, have, 're
Adjectives preceded by "самый", as well as others such as высший, младший, ярчайший, etc.
Nouns declined in the nominative case
Adjectives declined in the nominative case
Pronouns declined in the nominative case
Determiners declined in the nominative case
Nouns declined in the accusative case
Adjectives declined in the accusative case
Pronouns declined in the accusative case
Determiners declined in the accusative case
Prepositions that govern the accusative case
Nouns declined in the genitive case
Adjectives declined in the genitive case
Pronouns declined in the genitive case
Determiners declined in the genitive case
Prepositions that govern the genitive case
Nouns declined in the prepositional case
Adjectives declined in the prepositional case
Pronouns declined in the prepositional case
Determiners declined in the prepositional case
Prepositions which govern the prepositional case
Nouns declined in the dative case
Adjectives declined in the dative case
Pronouns declined in the dative case
Determiners declined in the dative case
Prepositions which govern the dative case
Nouns declined in the instrumental case
Adjectives declined in the instrumental case
Pronouns declined in the instrumental case

Prepositions which govern the instrumental case
Verbs > Verb forms > Present Active Participle
Verbs > Verb forms > Present Passive Participle
Verbs > Verb forms > Past Active Participle
Verbs > Verb forms > Past Passive Participle
Questions starting with "куда", e.g. Куда ты идешь?
Questions starting with "каков", e.g. Каков твой план?
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Present Tense
Verb forms that can be both perfective and imperfective
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Irregular Past
Verbs with irregular L-participle form (past tense)
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Irregular Present/Future
General negation, e.g. Нет, не, ни, никогда, никак, etc.
Questions that use "ли" or have no interrogative
Questions with direct interrogatives (other than "ли") often starting with "К-", e.g. как, когда, куда, где, etc.
Verbs with irregular forms in any tense, e.g. есть, хотеть, расти, etc.
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Future Imperfective
Imperfective verbs used as future tense
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Future Perfective
Perfective verbs used as future tense
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Past Perfective
Perfective verbs used in past tense
Verbs > Tenses and Aspect > Past Imperfective
Imperfective verbs used in past tense
Questions starting with "что", e.g. "Что вы делаете?"
Questions starting with "кто", e.g. "Кто хочет торт?"
Questions starting with "почему" or "зачем", e.g. "Почему ты не спишь?"
Questions starting with "где", e.g. "Где твоя сестра?"
Questions starting with "когда", e.g. "Когда он приехал?"
Questions starting with "чей", e.g. "Чья это книга?"
A subordinate clause that defines a noun phrase and starts with a relativizer (который, кто, etc.), e.g. "Человек, который был здесь, украл мою машину."
Verbs with accusative objects, e.g. "Я читаю книгу."
Verbs with genitive objects, e.g. "Я боюсь пауков."
Verbs with dative objects, e.g. "Я верю тебе."
Verbs with instrumental objects, e.g. "Я стану президентом"
1st conjugation verbs with underlying ай-/яй-/ей-, e.g. читать, менять, иметь
1st conjugation verbs with underlying ова-/ева-, e.g. чувствовать, воевать
1st conjugation verbs with underlying ну-, e.g. отдохнуть
2nd conjugation verbs with underlying и-, e.g. говорить
2nd conjugation verbs with underlying а-/оя-/е-, e.g. слышать, смотреть, стоять
1st conjugation verbs with underlying а-/я-, e.g. сказать, надеяться
1st conjugation verbs with underlying б-/д-/з-/с-/ст-/т-, e.g. лезть, везти, класть, расти
1st conjugation verbs with underlying г-/к-, e.g. мочь, печь
1st conjugation verbs with underlying TODO, e.g. умереть
1st conjugation verbs with underlying TODO, e.g. колоть, бороться
1st conjugation verbs with underlying C + fleeting vowel + й TODO, e.g. бить, вить, лить, пить, шить
1st conjugation verbs with underlying TODO, e.g. мыть, дуть, брить
1st conjugation verbs with underlying авай-, e.g. давать
1st conjugation verbs with underlying м-/н- TODO, plus деть, стать, жить, плыть
1st conjugation verbs with underlying м-/н- TODO
1st conjugation verbs with underlying н- TODO
1st conjugation verbs with underlying в- TODO
